4.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

9.text: Together they make up the Eggheads,

11.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

23.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

33.text: Taking on the awesome might of our quiz goliaths

36.text: are The Old Contemptibles from Huddersfield.

39.text: Now, everyone on this team is part of the Colne Valley Quiz League.

44.text: Hello, my name is Jimmy, I'm retired,

47.text: I was a subcontractor in the construction industry.

51.text: Hello, I'm David. Before I retired, I was a chartered accountant.

55.text: Hi, my name is Alistair, I manage a newsagent's shop.

59.text: Hi, I'm Jeremy and I'm a local government finance officer.

62.text: Hello, I'm Kay, I'm a legal officer for a local authority.

66.text: So, team, Jimmy, welcome and just tell us

69.text: why the name The Old Contemptibles? I know it's an important name.

73.text: Well, it was during the First World War

76.text: and my grandfather's regiment - unfortunately they got decimated

79.text: along with the Canadians and they were co-opted onto other regiments.

83.text:
- In his case, so I believe, it was the Lancashire Fusiliers... 
- Yeah.

92.text: they were the firing single-shot rifles at the Germans so fast,

96.text: the Germans thought they were being machine-gunned,

103.text: "Rid me of this contemptible little army."

106.text: They weren't able to do it.

109.text: And they took that as a compliment, not as an insult.

114.text: Hence, they got the nickname The Old Contemptibles.

118.text:
- That was my grandfather, yes. 
- If we said Old Contemptibles to

120.text: you, Chris, you'd be straight there, wouldn't you?

124.text: Veterans of the professional army of 1914, yeah.

126.text: Armed with the finest infantry weapon ever made,

131.text: And in the hands of a professional soldier, that was one deadly weapon.

134.text: And the Germans didn't like it up 'em, sir.

139.text: And the name came from the Kaiser. I didn't realise that.

141.text: Yeah, he referred, "Oh England's contemptible little army."

144.text: And they took a perverse pride in that -

148.text: OK, so you are now playing The Old Contemptibles here

151.text: and Jimmy and team. And, Alistair, the team captain,

153.text: you brought them together, is that right?

155.text: Yes. I'm more a middle-aged Contemptible, I think.

158.text: LAUGHTER Well, let's see how you go.

163.text: for our Challengers. However, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

166.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show.

- Yep.

- Kay, I think.

1700.text: It does mean the Challengers don't go home with the £17,000,

1704.text: so we'll add another 1,000 and play for that next time.

1707.text: Eggheads, well done. I'm going to say, hands on the table here,

1715.text: to see if a new team of Challengers can defeat them.

1718.text: £18,000 says they can't. Till then, goodbye.
